-1.title: Jacqueline Luongo
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Thrill Killers
1.plot: Deadly Women examines women who kill for the thrill of it including Melinda Loveless and her friends who young Shanda Sharer in Indiana, Brenda Spencer who went on a school shooting spree in California, and Tracey Wiggington who kills for blood in the so called 'lesbian Vampire murder' in Australia.

2.title: Fatal Attraction
2.plot: Deadly Woman looks at cases of women driven by obsessive love including Diane Downs shot her three children to win over a lover who didn't want children, Martha Wise poisoned three and crippled many others with poison, and the lesbian couple Valerie Parashumti and Jessica Stasinowsky drugged and strangled their 16-year-old roommate to death.

3.title: Twisted Minds
3.plot: A rifle in a shopping mall, a syringe of potassium chloride, and a syringe of insulin, each in the hands of a mentally disturbed woman, lead to the tragic end of many lives.

4.title: Dark Secrets
4.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where woman kill for secret reasons including Judy Buenoano who murdered lovers and her son in order to get insurance money, trans-gender Eugenia Falleni who killed her wife in order to protect the secret of her true gender, nurse Genene Jones who may have killed as many as 46 infants who were placed in her care.

5.title: Bad Medicine
5.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women use medicine to kill including nurse Beverley Allitt who kills multiple infants with medical overdoses, Stella Nickell who poisoned medicine capsules in stores, and Kathleen Follbigg who killed four of her own children with suffocation and concealed it as sudden infant death syndrome.

6.title: Predators
6.plot: Deadly Women examines cases of predatory women including Aileen Wuornos who shot and killed seven men in Florida over a period of two years, Dorothea Puente who killed and buried at least seven people in her Sacramento back yard, and Anna Hahn who poisoned numerous people in 1930s Cincinnati.

1.title: Young Blood
1.plot: Deadly Women looks at cases where young women kill including 11-year-old Mary Bell who killed two young boys in England, teen lovers Holly Harvey and Sandra Ketchum who kill Holly's disapproving grandparents so they can see each other, and 15-year-old Paula Cooper who leads a group of girls to stab to death a 78-year-old woman.

2.title: Blood for Money
2.plot: Money is the driving force behind many crimes, especially murder. These women would stop at nothing to get their hands on the cash they needed. From husbands to strangers to other people's babies - they spilled Blood for Money.

3.title: Disturbed
3.plot: Deadly Women examines cases of women killing out of madness including nurse Jane Toppan who sadistically murdered thirty-one of her patients, Dana Sue Gray who kills three women out of a desire for power and shopping money, and babysitter Christine Falling who suffocated the children she was hired to watch over.

4.title: Behind the Mask
4.plot: Deadly Women looks at cases where women murder in secret including Helen Golay and Olga Rutterschmidt who kill homeless men for insurance money, Betty Lou Beets who murder two husbands and bury them in the yard, and Kim Hricko who sets her husband on fire to hide an affair.

5.title: Forbidden Love
5.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women are driven to kill for forbidden love including the case of twelve year old "J.R." who killed her parents and brother with the help of her older boyfriend in Alberta, Sharee Miller who used the Internet to manipulate a boyfriend into killing her husband, and Kristin Rossum who killed her husband in order to conceal an affair.

6.title: Hearts of Darkness
6.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of jealousy including Winnie Ruth Judd who kills two of her friends over a man and leaves their body parts in a trunk, Carolyn Warmus who shot to death a man's wife in a desperate attempt to win him over, and Daphne Wright who killed another deaf woman in an effort to maintain a relationship.

7.title: Evil Influence
7.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill due to the sinister influences of others including Myra Hindley who helps her boyfriend kill five children, Susan Atkins, Patricia Krenwinkel and Leslie Van Houten who kill several prominent people in southern California under the guidance of Charles Manson, and Tania Herman who killed her lover's wife just because he asked her.

8.title: Fatal Obsession
8.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of obsession including Lisa Montgomery who kills a woman and steals her baby so people believe her phony pregnancy is true, Pauline Parker and Juliet Hulme who becomes obsessed with their fantasy world and kill one of their mothers to stay together, and Catherine Birnie who loved a serial killer and eventually became one.

9.title: Lethal Lovers
9.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where men and women team up to kill including Rosemary West and her husband who rape and murder at least eleven women, Martha Beck and her con artist boyfriend who trick women and kill at least three people, and Erika Sifrit and her husband who kill a couple after offering them an invitation to their condo.

10.title: Mothers Who Kill
10.plot: Deadly women examines cases where women kill their own children including Waneta Hoyt who kills her children and blames Sudden Infant Death Syndrome, Andrea Yates who drowns her five children to save their souls, and Susan Smith who drowns her two boys in order to win back her lover.

11.title: Born Bad
11.plot: Deadly Women considers women who may have been born bad including Gertrude Baniszewski who murders a sixteen year-old girl and gets her children to help, police officer Antoinette Frank who shot the owners of a restaurant she helped guard at night, and Sharon Kinne who left her life as a suburban mom for a life of crime.

12.title: Lethal Vengeance
12.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of revenge including Sarah Marie Johnson who killed both her parents because they wouldn't let her see her boyfriend, Piper Rountree who killed her ex-husband for leaving her, and Christa Pike who lead a group of teens in brutalizing a classmate.

13.title: Blood Lines
13.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where mothers convince their children to kill including Barbara Opel who convinced her daughter and friends to kill an old man who used to help them, Kate Bender who raised her family to be serial killers, and Sante Kimes who lead her son into a life of crime.

1.title: An Eye for an Eye
1.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of revenge including drug addict Karla Faye Tucker who killed an ex-boyfriend and her lover but later reformed in prison, Jessica McCord who used her children to lure her ex-husband to his death, and Clara Harris who ran over her cheating husband in the parking lot of hotel.

2.title: Outlaws
2.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women choose lives of crime including drug lord Griselda Blanco who has roughly 100 people murdered in Miami, Barbara Graham who pistol whipped to death an old widow out of hatred for her mother, and Juanita Spinelli who taught young teens to be her henchmen and eventually killed one to keep them quiet.

3.title: Fortune Hunters
3.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill to acquire wealth including serial wife Jill Coit who killed her eleventh husband after he found how many men she had married and wanted a divorce, former exotic dancer Marjorie Orbin who killed and dismembered the body of her rich husband, and Barbara Stager who shot her husband after he discovered that she was an adulteress and liar.

4.title: Dangerous Liaisons
4.plot: Deadly Women look at cases of couples who murder including teenager Caril Fugate and her boyfriend Charles Starkweather who go on a cross-country killing spree that takes eleven lives, Valmae Beck who willingly lures a twelve year-old girl into a trap of her sadistic husband, and Ashley Humphrey who stalks and kills her husband's ex-girlfriend to stop a rape charge.

5.title: Till Death Do Us Part
5.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill their husbands including Mary Winkler who killed her preacher husband claiming abuse, Rebecca Salcedo who killed her rich husband when she learn she would not get very much money if she divorced him, and Betty Broderick who killed her ex-husband in an effort to repay his cruelty.

6.title: Master Manipulators
6.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women manipulate men into murder including black widow Sharon Nelson who convinced her lover to kill her husband, Virginia Larzelere who manipulate her son into helping her kill her husband, and Sheila LaBarre who lured young men into affairs only to viciously turn on them.

7.title: The Sacred Bond
7.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill their own children including Theresa Knorr who was driven by delusions to brutally kill her two daughters, Debora Green who set her house on fire and killed two of her children in order to get back at her husband for leaving her, and Diane O'Dell who smothered her own children and collected them in boxes.

8.title: Beyond Suspicion
8.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women effectively conceal their murderous intentions including Tillie Gburek who posed as a fortune teller and killed people after predicted they would die, Beth Carpenter who killed her sister's husband after she was not granted custody of her sister's daughter, and Caroline Grills who poisoned several of her own relatives with thallium laced tea.

9.title: In Cold Blood
9.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women carefully plan out their murder schemes including Wendy Davidson who poisoned her husband with phenobarbital and then dumped his body in a lake, Anu Singh who planned an elaborate murder/suicide and survived, and Lynn Turner who married police two officers and killed them with poison.

10.title: Under His Control
10.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women are manipulated into murder by men including Jennifer Reali who was manipulated into murdering a man's wife by seduction and the Bible, Bonnie Heady who helped abduct and kill a six year-old boy with her boyfriend, and Dawn Silvernail who was coerced into killing another woman by Fred Andros.

11.title: Secrets and Lies
11.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women work to conceal their crimes including restaurateur Anjette Lyles who poisoned several members of her family when they got in her way, Susan Grund who killed her husband to conceal her double life, and Audrey Marie Hilley who killed her husband and moved away assuming another identity.

12.title: Love Gone Wrong
12.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of a twisted sense of love including Christine Paolilla who killed her four best friends at the prompting of her sociopath boyfriend, Penny Boudreau who killed her own child to keep her boyfriend, and prison worker Jennifer Hyatte who fell in love with a convict and killed in an effort to set him free.

13.title: A Daughter's Revenge
13.plot: Deadly Women looks at cases where daughters kill to get back at parents including Nicole Kasinskas a successful student who kills her mother when she is not allowed to live with her boyfriend, Constance Kent who kills her half-brother when she discovers that her father is having an affair, and Belinda Van Krevel who plots to kill her father after blaming him for her brother's arrest.

14.title: Love Sick
14.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where women kill out of twisted love including jealousy-driven Lisa Michelle Lambert who stalked and killed another teenager who was raped by her boyfriend, Daphne Abdela a spoiled rich girl who stabbed to death a drinking buddy, and Sarah Kolb who viciously murdered a young girl for kissing her boyfriend.

15.title: Married to Murder
15.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where young women kill including Chelsea Richardson and Susanna Toledano who killed Chelsea's parents so she could inherit their money, "Sandra" and "Beth" who killed their mother for her alcoholism, and Penny Bjorkland who shot a man just to find out what it was like.

16.title: Teen Killers
16.plot: Deadly Women examines cases where young women kill including Chelsea Richardson and Susanna Toledano who killed Chelsea's parents so she could inherit their money, "Sandra" and "Beth" who killed their mother for her alcoholism, and Penny Bjorkland who shot a man just to find out what it was like.

0.title: Killer Countdown Special
0.plot: A top ten countdown of the deadliest women from the series so far. Who is the murderess of them all?

1.title: Twisted Thrills
1.plot: The intimate thoughts of a twisted mind would be enough to stun a community and horrify the world. But thoughts alone may not be enough to turn someone into a killer. This is a bizarre journey into the world of women who kill for twisted thrills.

2.title: Loathe Thy Neighbour
2.plot: Neighbors can be a source of friendship and community comfort. But what happens when a neighbor stops watching out for you, and starts watching you. The sinister minds of these women begin to turn sour and they begin to torment their neighbors.

3.title: Hearts of Stone
3.plot: Deadly Women are not always the ones you expect. They are not the strangers lurking in the dark, they are a young mother, a supportive wife and a grandmother - all killers. Behind their loving masquerade lies a wake of family horror and pain.

4.title: Kill Their Own
4.plot: Convinced that all men cheat and lie, Susan Eubanks gets even with her ex-husbands - by killing her four sons in the same order in which they came into her life.

5.title: To Love and to Murder
5.plot: For these monstrous wives, it was only the wedding vow of 'death do us part' that they upheld.

6.title: Kill for Cash
6.plot: Money is a strong motivator. It can be used for good. It can be used for evil. It can be the driving force behind murder. These women would stop at nothing to get their hands on the cash they needed.

7.title: Breaking Point
7.plot: To save her daughter from being sexually assaulted, battered housewife Amber Cummings shoots her husband.

8.title: Love to Death
8.plot: Love and money are a beautiful marriage, for the lucky ones they create a life of happiness and ease. Unless the love is of money, the bride is a killer, and the groom their victim.

9.title: Sacrifice Their Blood
9.plot: To the outside world these caring mothers present a face of love - a suburban Mom, a caring community member, a housewife - but when the doors close, these deadly women will do whatever it takes to have their own needs met, even destroy their family.

10.title: Deadly Possessions
10.plot: These women- a grandmother caring for her grandchildren, a young girl in love with a boy, a mother protecting her son - are consumed with intense love. But when that love is threatened, they find it too much to bear and take measures into their own hands.

11.title: An Inconvenient Marriage
11.plot: Includes the story of Raynella Dossett Leath.

13.title: Pleasure from Pain
13.plot: Some women are so depraved that their thoughts are unspeakable, their actions incomprehensible. This is the deadly woman's house of sullen delight, a torturous world for those who receive pleasure from pain.

14.title: Lethal Love
14.plot: Love is a powerful emotion, one that sits in the core of our soul and fills our lives with hope. But when love turns sour, the results can be deadly. In an act of revenge these deadly women unite with one common goal, to kill.

15.title: Baby-Faced Killers
15.plot: These baby-faced girls may look childish and innocent, but behind their little girl smiles lies and darkness most adults never experience. When their inner turmoil bubbles to the surface, they become unlikely criminals.

16.title: Senseless Slayings
16.plot: When a person places no value on human life, they can become unstoppable in their twisted missions to destroy the lives around them. These women all pushed boundaries, and shattered lives with their actions.

17.title: Lover's Revenge
17.plot: These women burn madly with anger so deep they'll kill to satisfy it. What makes them turn on the ones they love? Find out as we explore the reasons for a lover's revenge.

18.title: Deadly Delinquents
18.plot: Kirsten Costas reminds stabs to death classmate Bernadette Protti. Karen Severson and Laura Doyle were friends with Missy Avila since grade school, but as they grow older, Missy blossoms into a beautiful, charming young lady and the friendship dissolves. Karen and Laura take her into the woods, beat her up, cut her hair and drown her in the lake. Kelly Fuller decides to end the source of jealousy permanently by stabbing her ex's new girlfriend, Kelly Lang almost 50 times.

19.title: Match Made for Murder
19.plot: When a woman wants more from her husband than he can give, marriage can be a dangerous union. For these deadly women, relationships mean nothing more than a match made for murder.

20.title: Killer Kids
20.plot: For many parents, their children's teen years can be one big headache. But when typical teenage rebellion turns into deadly rage, a parent's love may not be enough to save their life.

1.title: Hunting Humans
1.plot: When a killer is in the pursuit of blood, being caught in their path is a dangerous place to be - unless you are the partner in crime. When these Deadly Women meet their mates, they not only gain a partner in life, but also in the hunt.

2.title: Parents Peril
2.plot: Missing her mother's companionship, beautiful and intelligent high school student Marie Robards poisons her loving father to move back in with her mom. She keeps it a secret for a year until her college roommate recites Claudius's guilt monologue from Hamlet, causing her to break down. The ways of wild, promiscuous "jazz baby" Dorothy Ellingson don't mesh with those of her old-fashioned parents who try to keep her from partying. Enraged at her parents and desperate for freedom, Dorothy shoots her mother in the head and goes partying afterwards. In prison, she appears ...

3.title: Insatiable Greed
3.plot: Louise Vermilyea becomes so infatuated with dead bodies that she feels compelled to poison and kill 10 people over a period of 18 years. For this insatiable woman, the death of her victims isn't enough.

4.title: Matriarchs of Murder
4.plot: Deadly Women are often cloaked. One woman's killings go undetected for years; a Granny whose husbands keep dying avoids suspicion for half a decade, and a divorcee uses friendship to kill. Family and friends mean nothing to these "Matriarchs of Murder".

5.title: Web of Death
5.plot: Love in the Internet age is complicated; you never know who you'll meet. A surrogate uses love as a lure; a serial wife finds murder more profitable than divorce; and a housewife finds happiness in a gun. All trapped their victims in a 'Web of Death'.

6.title: Murder of Innocence
6.plot: A mother's role is to love and to care for her children Â- to put the Â'other' above Â'herself'. But for these Â'Deadly Women', the very opposite rings true when they break the sacred bond of their children's love in the Â'Murder of Innocence'.

7.title: Love You to Pieces
7.plot: When women possess irresistible charm, the men in their lives can be easily blinded to their dangerous ways. These women can use their fierce passion to love, but it can also be deadly.

8.title: No Good Reason
8.plot: Motive is the cause that moves people to do anything, to induce any action. But when these Deadly Women kill it is because they are curious, angry and or because they can. They don't have motive for killing their victims, they murder for Â'No Good Reason'.

9.title: Teen Terror
9.plot: Natasha Cornett and her Goth Gang.

10.title: Too Close for Comfort
10.plot: Malaika Griffin is known as a brilliant chemist who graduated from college cum laude, but has a hot temper and harbors an intense hatred for white people. One night, she gets into a heated argument with her white neighbor, Jason Horsley, and his girlfriend. When the girlfriend leaves, Malaika shoots Jason in the back and runs away while he dies, evading capture for several years. Ellen Etheridge is ecstatic when she gets to marry her new millionaire husband after his wife passes away. However, she's not so fond of having to fight for his love due to her eight new ...

11.title: Ruthless Revenge
11.plot: Revenge is a dish best served cold, and for these Deadly Women, it is the motto by which they live their lives, exacting their vengeance in cold blood when they kill and commit 'Ruthless Revenge'.

12.title: Bury Their Babies
12.plot: A mother's impulse to love and protect her child is a sentiment hard-wired into the brain. But when these Deadly Women go against the most primal and basic instinct to protect their young, we are forced to watch as they Â'Bury Their Babes'.

13.title: Kinky Killers
13.plot: It is often said there is safety in numbers, but when these Deadly Women pair up with killer men who can match their evil thoughts and actions, they spiral into a world of sickening fantasies and the horror of Â'Kinky Killers'.

14.title: Death Benefits
14.plot: Manling "Ling" Williams smothered her two boys to death and brutally murdered her husband with a Katana sword so that she could start a new life with another man.

15.title: Mommy's Little Helpers
15.plot: In high school, she was known as "Mean Nadean". In 1982 she and her 18 year old son, James Gregory Smith, tortured and killed his ex-girlfriend, Cynthia Lucille Baillee. She had been shot a total of 9 times, stabbed in the throat and stomped on. Some reports claim Cynthia was going to turn Greg in to local law enforcement for his involvement with drugs; other reports claim she was trying to arrange Greg's murder. Either way, Lois Nadean Smith took an active role in coming to her son's aid. They picked Cynthia up at a motel and drove her to Smith's ex-husband's house. ...

16.title: Eternal Revenge
16.plot: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned. When a virtuous woman is seduced, a lover betrayed and a manipulative wife left behind, these Deadly Women exact their 'Eternal Revenge'.

17.title: Without Conscience
17.plot: Murder blackens the soul. And for these Deadly Women, it is their already darkened soul and disturbed minds that create a new level of horror when they shoot, beat, torture, burn and dismember their victims. These Deadly Women kill "Without Conscience".

18.title: Bury the Boyfriend
18.plot: A first love, a new love, and an old love are relationships most of us hold dear to our hearts. But for these heartless Deadly Women, love is unattainable. It is a gift that dies with their victim when they "Bury the Boyfriend".

19.title: Death Knock
19.plot: Home is where the heart is, a place to welcome friends and gather families; full of warm memories and good times. But when these Deadly Women come to the door, their victims have no idea they have just heard the sound of a "Death Knock".

20.title: Brides of Blood
20.plot: These Deadly Women have a dangerous charm. The men who meet them love them. But underneath lies the chilling darkness of a tortured mind. When loved and nurtured they shine, but when pushed too far these blushing brides become the "Brides of Blood".

1.title: Malicious Hearts
1.plot: Some women have ice running through their veins. They lack the instinct to care. A mom locks up and tortures her daughter like she's a prisoner-of-war; a helpful neighbor quietly kills her community; and lesbian lovers bash and burn a complete stranger.

2.title: Money Hungry
2.plot: When a woman's only desire in life is to be wealthy she will do anything to get it. A California businesswoman targets a Lotto winner and takes more than his cash; a young bride's charm masks her brutal nature and a sea voyage ends with man overboard.

3.title: Without Pity
3.plot: Some women are just cold-hearted and attack "Without Pity". A mother who wants another baby is prepared to steal from the womb; a grandmother's outward devotion masks her sadistic nature; and an unhappy divorcee takes revenge on her own flesh and blood.

4.title: Mean Teens
4.plot: Baby-face looks can be misleading. These teen girls want to live like grown-ups, and won't let anyone stop them. A teen wants to date more than she wants her mother; a student makes herself an orphan and a girl sacrifices her grandmother to be with a boy.

5.title: Vicious Vixens
5.plot: Cross these deadly vixens at your own risk. An English beauty spars with her boyfriend, a middle-aged woman sacrifices lives for money, and a couple of game players lure an innocent man into a deadly trap: these women will certainly fight to the death.

6.title: Evil Guardians
6.plot: A mother's role is to love & protect her children, but for some, that doesn't ring true. When a Missouri mom uses her children for money, a Texas mom's becomes delusional, & an Australian gives her son a watery grave, it's clear they lack motherly love.

7.title: Wed to Murder
7.plot: Donna Horwitz seems to have it all - a millionaire husband, a loving son, and an enormous house with hired help - but surfaces deceive. Miserable, and provoked to rage by her husband's indifference, she shoots him dead.

8.title: Lethal Teens
8.plot: Teenage years can be fraught with difficulties. While some teens stay close to home, others stray from the fold to enter a different dark and dangerous world. Gifted with youth and burdened by demons, these Deadly Women look too young to do harm.

9.title: Above the Law
9.plot: Social status seems to place these women above suspicion, including the crimes of the "mother of modern adoptions," Georgia Tann.

10.title: Sadistic Souls
10.plot: Deadly Women fuses bone chilling story telling, sumptuous period drama and forensic fact in a bid to explore history's most alluring, intriguing and horrifying female killers.

11.title: Heartless Souls
11.plot: What makes a deadly woman? Is it nurture, nature or something in between? Sometimes evil seems to lurk from the beginning, and there's no stopping it. For these deadly women, cruelty comes from deep within.

12.title: Vengeance
12.plot: Ellie Nesler sends her son Willie away to a Christian summer camp, where he and several other boys are molested by Daniel Driver. On the day of Driver's trial, an outraged Nesler shoots and kills him in court. She serves three years for manslaughter but later returns to jail for selling drugs, while her now-adult son is himself incarcerated for murder. In 1966, girls' school headmistress Jean Harris falls for future Scarsdale Diet creator Dr. Herman Tarnower, but he womanizes constantly and gets her hooked on speed. In March 1980, after the doctor finally dumps Jean ...

13.title: Dark Hearts
13.plot: Not every woman's heart is filled with love and light. A dance teacher waltzes her way to financial gain; a daughter sows a murderous seed; and a lonely heart spawns a damaged mind. For these women, romance truly is dead, they possess 'Dark Hearts.'

14.title: Innocent Blood
14.plot: Some women can't cope with raising a child. A young mom commits the ultimate act of betrayal; a jealous lover plots a horrible revenge; and twins becomes twice as hard for a housewife. These Deadly Women are willing to sacrifice Â'Innocent Blood'.

15.title: Double Trouble
15.plot: Sometimes, a woman has a killer instinct when she meets her other half. These wicked women exert control over their partners to become the master puppeteer of a murderous plot. Acting as two on behalf of one, these Deadly Women are Â'Double Trouble'.

16.title: Killer Kin
16.plot: Some women expect too much from their flesh and blood. When these Deadly Women convince their closest relatives to become a party to murder, they know their families won't let them down. Blood is thicker than water, when they enlist their "Killer Kin."

17.title: No Mercy
17.plot: Some women don't have a kind bone in their body. They take lives without a second thought. A mom sacrifices her son; a greedy book-keeper steals her way to murder and a teen takes her rebellion to shocking heights. These Deadly Women have "No Mercy."

18.title: Souls of Stone
18.plot: Selfish women will sometimes sell their souls to the devil to get what they want. A scorned lover weaves a web of lies, a teenage Goth orders a reign of terror, and a gold-digger buries secrets in her basement. These Deadly Women have "Souls of Stone."

19.title: Brutal Brides
19.plot: A prim Californian woman chooses to commit a deadly sin rather than live with an immoral husband, a bustling housewife whips up a recipe for riches and greed drives two women to join a murderous poison ring.

20.title: Untamed Evil
20.plot: A love-struck Texan will go to any lengths to keep her man, a gun-toting redhead shoots first and asks questions later, and a mother with a vile temper does the unthinkable to her tiny son.

2.title: Mom's Money
2.plot: A former Burbank High School honors student and cheerleader, was sentenced in 1996 to life in prison without parole for killing her mother, Dixie Hollier, a Warner Bros. record executive. Bray's boyfriend was also convicted.

3.title: Never Too Young
3.plot: Katie Belflower is a California girl with a penchant for stealing other girl's boyfriends. She begins an affair with Michael Simons, the husband of her 17 year-old classmate Jenna Nannetti. Katie, Michael, and a friend named Jeffrey Hamilton plot to kill Jenna in 2002. Months later, Katie and Jeffrey attempt to kill another girl, Aspen Lum, and during the attack, Katie admits to killing Jenna. Katie is serving 25 years to life in prison. Michael Simons gets life without parole and Jeffrey Hamilton gets 20 years to life.

4.title: Three's a Crowd
4.plot: Love is usually a game for two -- when three try to play, somebody will lose out. An obsessed wife fixates on revenge, a lustful affair breeds a wicked plot, and a wealthy housewife hides more than skeletons in her closet.

5.title: Catch Me If You Can
5.plot: Middle aged and middle class mother-of-one Jean was a trained nurse and a flight steward with no criminal record, that is until she slashed the throat of one of her close girlfriends, Gladys. The motive Jean found out that Gladys who had recently separated from her husband was having an affair with her husband. She didn't just kill Gladys she tried to torture information out of her by stabbing her in the arms, legs and torso. She then left Gladys to bleed to death. Jean got away with murder and kept her husband for some 16 years until a cold case unit trapped her in ...

6.title: Hunger for Cash
6.plot: For some women, a craving for cash can trump the lives of the innocent. A nurse decides to cash in her housemate, a sister swaps her brother for a new bank balance and an embezzler uses arsenic to balance the books. All 3 women killed for money, the had a hunger for cash.

7.title: Self-Made Widows
7.plot: When these women fell out of love they didn't walk away; they chose a permanent separation with financial benefits. They all wanted to be single but with no strings attached; they were 'Self Made Widows'.

8.title: Lover's Revenge (2nd)
8.plot: Love is a powerful force, but it is not as strong as vengeance. A scorned lover wants to settle the score, a sex obsessed flirt wants a wife gone and why does a mother take a custody battle a step too far? When they took the law into their own hands innocent lives were lost, noting could stand in the way of their lover's revenge.

9.title: Heartless
9.plot: Some women's actions are so cold, so vicious, it's unbelievable. A street crusader takes the law into her own hands, a spoiled rich kid wants to kill and a college student's idea of a thrill is brutal. These deadly women committed actions so vicious they seem heartless.

10.title: Second Best
10.plot: Being the 'other woman' is a lonely life. Some turn rejection into rage. A call girl craved the high life, a teen mom eradicated her rival, and a lesbian love affair ripped a family apart. These Deadly Women refused to play 'Second Best'.

11.title: For the Money, Honey
11.plot: Financially motivated killers, including Melissa Ann Shepard, Kelly Gissendaner,Ada Wittenmyer.

12.title: Cold as Ice
12.plot: A divorced woman fakes a home invasion; a mix of jealousy and alcohol affect a U.K. mother; and a drug kingpin eliminates the competition.

13.title: If Looks Could Kill
13.plot: In the Bronx, Angela Murray is talked into hooking as a temporary means to pay her rent. She targets 92-year-old Felix Brinkmann, and recruits two hoods to help her but the former disco owner puts up a fight.

14.title: To Have and to Kill
14.plot: When some brides vowed to love and honor their husbands, they lied. These Deadly Women made a mockery of marital commitment. They only promised "To Have and To Kill".

15.title: Mad or Bad
15.plot: Some women tread a fine line between anger and insanity. A bondage queen punishes her rival, a teenager wreaks fiery revenge, and a doctor prescribes a lethal cure for her problems. These Deadly Women are damaged goods, but are they "Mad or Bad"?

16.title: Scorned
16.plot: Love brings hope and happiness, but broken hearts can leave a trail of blood and tears. When lovers and friends dump these women, they take the ultimate revenge. These Deadly Women prove hell hath no fury like a woman "Scorned".

17.title: Total Control
17.plot: Some women must always get their way. A seductress has men and women under her spell, a churchgoer finds a new form of faith, and a matriarch rules with an iron rod. These Deadly Women want power at any price, because they demand "Total Control".

18.title: Hidden Rage
18.plot: Some women's feminine wiles mask their true natures. On the surface these women appear fun, but if you cross them they turn lethal. When these Deadly Women felt let down, they took revenge and revealed their "Hidden Rage".

19.title: Two to Terminate
19.plot: When it came to murder, these women thought two minds were better than one. They were the masterminds, but didn't want to get their hands dirty. For these Deadly Women, it took "Two to Terminate".

20.title: In the Family
20.plot: Farzana and Iftikha Ahmed plot to kill their daughter Shafilea.

1.title: Lady of Blood
1.plot: Lizzie Borden, American most infamous murderess. Born into a wealthy respected family, Lizzie was a quiet, Sunday school teacher - that is until she took an ax and hacked her stepmother and and father to death. Or did she?

2.title: Sandra Layne
2.plot: Doris Ann Carlson is an Arizona woman living for her mother-in-law, Lynne Carlson, who suffers from multiple sclerosis. While Doris is supposed to be caring for Lynne, she and her husband David instead use Lynne for her money. When the money runs out, Doris hires two young men to stab her mother-in-law to death, but Lynne doesn't succumb to her injuries for six months. Doris is sentenced to death for plotting the murder, but it is reduced to life. Amber Bray is an intelligent and ambitious high school senior who falls for an older, high school dropout named Jeff Ayers...

7.title: Self Made Widows
7.plot: When these women fell out of love they didn't walk away; they chose a permanent separation with financial benefits. They all wanted to be single but with no strings attached; they were 'Self Made Widows'.

13.title: If Looks Could Kill
13.plot: Beauty is only skin deep; scratch the surface and you could find an ugly soul. A gorgeous girl preys on an elderly man, a cabaret star performs a killer finale, and a farmer's wife harvests husbands. These Deadly Women get their way "If Looks Could Kill".

1.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
1.plot: A self centered former beauty queen Darlene Gentry from Texas (USA), decides to end her marriage at the same time profit from it. She decides to do both by shooting her husband to make it look like a robbery and cashing in on a $500.000 life insurance policy. Surviving an abusive childhood. British, Carol Croydon grew up to marry a wealthy upholsterer Philip Croydon, who pampers her with gifts, but the marriage is loveless and both engage in extramarital affairs. In 2003, she lures him to a hotel room then stabs him 22 times and claims he was murdered by sex swingers....

2.title: D.I.Y Orphans
2.plot: For these women blood isn't thicker than water. A teen sacrifices her family for an early inheritance; an obsession with Hollywood memorabilia leads a recluse to kill her parents; and a soccer mom's social status is more important than her mother's life.

3.title: Gambling Lives Away
3.plot: These women love to gamble; but when the money's all gone, the stakes turn deadly. A transgender woman is willing to kill for a new body; a mother and daughter trade a family member for a payout; and a wife tries to bury her debts along with her husband.

4.title: Green-Eyed Monsters
4.plot: Rejection and betrayal are good enough reasons for these women to commit heinous crimes.

5.title: Payback
5.plot: When these women have scores to settle, they take matters into their own hands. A traumatized woman thinks she's an avenging angel; one of Mexico's most infamous serial killers targets the elderly; and a man is butchered by two women he tries to help.

6.title: Get Rich Quick
6.plot: These women think their men are worth more dead than alive. A scorned Southern belle tries to cash in on her ex's life; a countess clings to her riches through violent means; and a mother of two trades her husband for another shot at the good life.

7.title: Two to Kill
7.plot: Some women like company when they take a life. Teenage lovers chose each other over the life of a loving grandmother; a cold-hearted aunt uses her nephew to become a wealthy widow; and a friendship turns fatal for one unsuspecting husband.

8.title: Never Too Old
8.plot: They look like sweet grannies but they prove murder has no age limit. A grandma's need to control her grandson takes a deadly turn; a retirement home romance meets a lethal end; and an ageing gold-digger preys on her final victim.

9.title: Forever and a Day
9.plot: When a former police officer is dumped she takes the law into her own hands; a quiet housewife buries her marriage problems in the garden; and an excited fiancée turns into the worst kind of bridezilla.

10.title: Red Hot Temper
10.plot: Some women have short fuses, and when their blood boils get out of their way. A couple's New Year's resolution ends in a murderous rampage; a pious parish housekeeper hides a sinful secret and a Christmas drink between neighbors has a deadly hangover.

11.title: Murder for Me
11.plot: Some women like others to do their dirty work. A drama queen brings her love triangle to a permanent end; an intimate betrayal turns friends into deadly foes; and a loose woman will do anything to protect her freedom.

12.title: Girl on Girl
12.plot: They may be the fairer sex but when they clash it can be downright brutal. An abusive mother takes drastic steps to keep custody of her child; a small town gossip sparks a murderous grudge match; and a teen bully makes a shocking move.

13.title: The Vulnerable
13.plot: A secret addiction drives a young woman to sacrifice her wheelchair bound employer; a scheming caregiver betrays the man who trusts her; and a single mother's desire for a better life leads to a brutal dismemberment.

1.title: Killer Cougars
1.plot: Some women can't resist boy toys. But fur flies when these Deadly Women reveal they're "Killer Cougars."

2.title: Granny Gets a Gun
2.plot: These Deadly Women are old but not wise. You have to watch your back when "Granny Gets a Gun."

3.title: Bad to the Bone
3.plot: The real life stories of three women, who betrayed the trust of loved ones and led them down the wrong path until it turned deadly.

4.title: Cling 'Til Death
4.plot: The stories of three different women who couldn't let go of their men and ended up killing them.

5.title: Sugar & Spite
5.plot: They look sugar coated but these Deadly Women are made of "Sugar And Spite."

6.title: Cash In
6.plot: The stakes are high and the chips are down when these Deadly Women decide to "Cash In."

7.title: Killers-in-Laws
7.plot: These Deadly Women satisfied their blood lust within the family... they were "Killer In-Laws."

8.title: Suspicious Minds
8.plot: Jealous women are capable of anything but when they are also armed and furious, a disaster is waiting to happen.

9.title: Unspeakable Acts
9.plot: Greed and lust drove these Deadly Women to commit "Unspeakable Acts."

10.title: DIY Burial
10.plot: Dig into the world of these Deadly Women... and in their "DIY Burial," you will find blood and bone.

11.title: Anger Mismanagement
11.plot: The match is struck, the fuse is lit, and it's only a matter of time before the "Anger Mismanagement" of these Deadly Women will see them explode.

12.title: Love Leaves Town
12.plot: With hearts of stone, these Deadly Women give their men special send-offs when "Love Leaves Town."

13.title: Friends to Foes
13.plot: It's easy to keep friends and enemies close when they're one and the same. These Deadly Women turn from "Friends To Foes."

1.title: Mid Life Murder
1.plot: These Deadly Women didn't grow old gracefully; they committed "Mid-Life Murder."

2.title: Illicit and Lethal
2.plot: The real life stories of three different women who went crazy after their love interests dumped them. Shannon O'Rourke Griffin went after her husband's psychiatrist and mistress, Patricia Tito shot her ex-lovers new relationship and Manisha Patel lost control when she found out her boyfriend had a fiancee.

3.title: Broken Ties
3.plot: These Deadly Women brutally turned on family and in-laws, they had "Broken Ties."

4.title: The Dark Side
4.plot: These Deadly Women aren't afraid to take a walk on "The Dark Side."

5.title: Two To Tangle
5.plot: These Deadly Women liked company when they killed, for them it took "Two to Tangle."

6.title: Hit and Run
6.plot: Two can keep a secret, if one of them is dead. These Deadly Women think they've committed the perfect murders when they "Hit and Run."

7.title: Death Watch
7.plot: These Deadly Women get their kicks from the suffering of others. They enjoy being on "Death Watch."

8.title: Hot Tempers, Cold Hearts
8.plot: When these Deadly Women turn green-eyed they reveal their "Hot Tempers, Cold Hearts."

9.title: The Love of Money
9.plot: These Deadly Women sacrificed their loved ones to satisfy their "Love of Money."

10.title: Fatal Ties
10.plot: These Deadly Women take the wedding vow "till death do us part" seriously; they make sure their marriages are "Fatal Ties."

11.title: In the Family 2nd
11.plot: When these Deadly Women strike they keep it "In The Family."

12.title: Tipping Point
12.plot: Innocent blood spills when these Deadly Women reach their "Tipping Point."

13.title: Dumped and Dangerous
13.plot: When their love life goes sour these Deadly Women take lethal revenge. They are "Dumped and Dangerous."

1.title: Married Today, Gone Tomorrow
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

3.title: Friends are Foes
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Twisted Desires
5.plot: Every murder is a tragedy but some are plain barbaric.

6.title: The Blame Game
6.plot: Some women can't admit their failings. They point the finger of blame at others.

7.title: When Love Turns to Hate
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: Boiling Point
9.plot: A beautiful face can mask the ugliest of intentions.

imdb.plot outline: Deadly Women fuses bone chilling story telling, sumptuous period drama and forensic fact in a bid to explore history's most alluring, intriguing and horrifying female killers. Each episode profiles four famous cases from the past and delves into a deadly world shaped by spiraling forces that are beyond the women's control: obsession, greed, and revenge.
imdb.title: Deadly Women
plot: True stories of female killers.::Bill K

_Deadly Women_ (qv) fuses bone chilling story telling, sumptuous period drama and forensic fact in a bid to explore history's most alluring, intriguing and horrifying female killers. Each episode profiles four famous cases from the past and delves into a deadly world shaped by spiraling forces that are beyond the women's control: obsession, greed, and revenge.::Toby Padilla
